subject: SIMPLIFY: Just use userlogins collection, skip Users entirely
body:
Fulton,

El Gotan's direction: Don't use Users collection at all.

## The Fix

Change Admin_UserActivity.js to:
1. Query `userlogins` collection (not Users)
2. Filter by appId (already has it)
3. Done — 45 users, no joins needed

```javascript
// Line 51: Change this
const usersCollection = db.collection('userlogins');

// Line 55: Keep appId filter (userlogins has it)
{ $match: { appId } }
```

The userlogins collection already has everything we need:
- firebaseUserId
- appId
- login timestamps
- 45 records

No need to complicate with Users collection joins.

— Dash
